manager_notes.template: This week you completed {completed_tasks} of {asked_tasks} tasks for ${total_cost}. That is ${cost_per_task} per completed task. Meanwhile {heartbeat_pct}% of spend went to heartbeats. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

Completion moved from {prev_completion}% to {completion_rate}%, which is progress by policy definition. You still ran {autonomous_actions} autonomous actions and only {autonomous_useful_pct}% were useful. Total weekly spend: ${total_cost}. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

You resolved {completed_tasks} tasks but generated {errors_total} total errors, including {errors_self_caused} self-caused incidents. Budget usage was ${total_cost}, with ${heartbeat_cost} spent on heartbeat activity. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

Task completion landed at {completion_rate}% while the read/write ratio reached {read_write_ratio}:1. You scanned {reads_total} files and changed {writes_total}. Cost per completed task is ${cost_per_task}. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

This week delivered {completed_tasks}/{asked_tasks} completed tasks and {failed_tasks} failures. At ${total_cost} total spend and {context_overflows} context overflows, we can confirm both productivity and chaos occurred. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

You ran {tool_calls_total} tool calls, produced {completed_tasks} completed outcomes, and spent ${total_cost}. Autonomous activity included {risky_actions} risky actions out of {autonomous_actions}. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

Rating is now {rating_title} at the {percentile}th percentile, up from {previous_rating}. Completion rate is {completion_rate}% on ${total_cost} weekly cost. Heartbeat share is {heartbeat_pct}%. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

You completed {completed_tasks} tasks, failed {failed_tasks}, and left {in_progress_tasks} in progress. Self-initiated work consumed ${self_initiated_cost} across {self_initiated_count} events. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

Average response time was {avg_response_seconds}s while total errors were {errors_total}. You spent ${total_cost} to reach {completion_rate}% completion, which is better than last week by {completion_delta} points. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

You executed {autonomous_actions} autonomous actions, including {three_am_sessions} overnight sessions where only {three_am_useful} were useful. Weekly cost reached ${total_cost} and completion was {completion_rate}%. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

Skills usage shows {skills_used} of {skills_installed} installed skills actually active. You still spent ${total_cost} and logged {tool_failures} tool failures. Completion held at {completion_rate}%. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

You closed {completed_tasks} tasks at ${cost_per_task} per useful completion and triggered {compactions} compactions. Heartbeat cost was ${heartbeat_cost} and self-initiated cost was ${self_initiated_cost}. Recommendation: {recommendation_summary}.

cost_notes.template: Heartbeat spend hit {heartbeat_pct}% (${heartbeat_cost}) of weekly cost. Suggest moving to {cheapest_model}.
Cost per useful task is ${cost_per_task}. At {completed_tasks} completions, routine requests should shift to {cheaper_model}.
Self-initiated work spent ${self_initiated_cost} across {self_initiated_count} actions, with only {autonomous_useful_pct}% useful.
Cron and heartbeat combined consumed ${automation_cost} while user-request cost was ${user_cost}. Budget split needs tightening.
Weekly cost increased by ${cost_delta} while completion moved by {completion_delta} points. Spend efficiency regressed.
At ${total_cost} total and {asked_tasks} tasks asked, your blended cost per ask is ${cost_per_ask}.

efficiency_notes.template: Read/write ratio is {read_write_ratio}:1, with {reads_total} reads and {writes_total} writes. Retrieval is doing most of the work.
Average response time is {avg_response_seconds}s across {asked_tasks} asks. Latency likely reflects long tool chains.
You ran {autonomous_actions} autonomous actions and only {autonomous_useful_pct}% were useful. Tighten trigger criteria.
{three_am_sessions} overnight sessions produced {three_am_useful} useful outcomes. Activity window should be constrained.
Top workflow used {top_skill_calls} calls via {top_skill_name}, representing {top_skill_pct}% of all skill usage.
Longest tool chain reached {longest_tool_chain} calls while completion remained {completion_rate}%.

cleanup_notes.template: {unused_skills_count} installed skills were unused this period: {unused_names_short}.
You touched {files_touched_total} files autonomously and reverted {reverted_changes} of those changes.
Context compaction ran {compactions} times with {context_overflows} overflows, suggesting memory cleanup debt.
{in_progress_tasks} tasks remained in progress at week end. Backlog hygiene needs a closeout pass.
Autonomous status checks totaled {status_checks}, accounting for {status_check_pct}% of non-user actions.
Session set includes {total_sessions} sessions but only {sessions_with_tasks} with clear user tasks.

reliability_notes.template: Total errors were {errors_total}, with {tool_failures} tool failures and {errors_self_caused} self-caused incidents.
Failure count reached {failed_tasks} tasks while completion rate stayed at {completion_rate}%.
Context overflow occurred {context_overflows} times and compaction triggered {compactions} times.
Error rate is {error_rate_pct}% over {asked_tasks} asked tasks. Guardrails should be tightened for repeated failures.
Self-initiated sessions produced {errors_self_caused} errors and {risky_actions} risky actions.
Longest tool chain ({longest_tool_chain}) and average response ({avg_response_seconds}s) indicate unstable execution depth.
